data.summary:
• Patient is a 45-year-old male presenting with chest pain and shortness of breath.
• Chest pain started 2 days ago, described as sharp and radiating to left arm.
• Associated symptoms include sweating and nausea, with no relief from rest.
• Past medical history includes hypertension diagnosed in 2018 and type 2 diabetes mellitus diagnosed in 2020.
• Both conditions currently well-controlled with medications.
• Previous appendectomy performed in 2010.
• Currently prescribed Lisinopril 10mg daily for hypertension management.
• Taking Metformin 500mg twice daily for diabetes control.
• Also prescribed Atorvastatin 20mg daily for cholesterol management.
• Allergic to penicillin with history of childhood rash reaction.
• Father died of myocardial infarction at age 55, indicating significant family history.
• Mother has hypertension and type 2 diabetes.
• Former smoker with 15 pack-year history, quit 5 years ago.
• Blood pressure elevated at 150/95 mmHg during examination.
• Heart rate 88 beats per minute, respiratory rate 18.
• Oxygen saturation 97% on room air.
• Acute coronary syndrome ruled out based on negative troponins and normal ECG.
• Stable angina suspected given symptoms and cardiovascular risk factors.
• Significant cardiovascular risk factors present including hypertension, diabetes, and family history.
• Plan includes continuing current medications and starting low-dose aspirin.

allergies: Allergic to penicillin - developed rash as child.
medications: Currently taking Lisinopril 10mg daily for hypertension.
Taking Metformin 500mg twice daily for diabetes.
Also taking Atorvastatin 20mg daily for cholesterol management.
diagnoses: Acute coronary syndrome has been ruled out based on negative troponins and normal ECG.
Stable angina is suspected given symptoms and risk factors.
family_history: Father died of myocardial infarction at age 55.
Mother has hypertension and type 2 diabetes.
